business.headline: Terrific effort but still away from being Good and Simple Tax: Ex-CEA on GST 2.0Former Chief Economic Advisor Arvind Subramanian analyses the recent GST rationalisation. He states the tax has become "more good and more simple" with the removal of the 28% slab, but cautions, "we're still some ways away from reaching that goal."

Gold prices surge by Rs 900 to Rs 1.07 lakh amid interest rate cut hopesGold of 99.5 per cent purity advanced by Rs 900 to Rs 1,06,100 per 10 grams (inclusive of all taxes) on Friday, from the previous close of Rs 1,05,200 per 10 grams.

India's forex reserves rise by $3.5 billion to $694 billion, says RBIFor the week ended August 29, foreign currency assets, a major component of the reserves, increased by USD 1.686 billion to USD 583.937 billion.
Urban Company and 2 IPOs lined for next week. Check GMP and detailsUrban Company, Dev Accelerator and Shringar House of Mangalsutra will all launch their IPOs on September 10, 2025.

The truth behind "Guaranteed 8–10% Returns": Expert explains the realityMany savers in India are often attracted to insurance plans that promise "guaranteed" returns, offering the appeal of steady growth without exposure to market risks. But do these policies actually deliver what they claim?

Nirmala Sitharaman on GST 2.0, citizen relief, and way forwardIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman talked about the next-generation GST reforms, GST classification, how the GST reforms benefits will be passed on to common man, the opposition's 'Gabbar Singh Tax' jibe on GST and much more.

Finance Minister on GST Slabs, Medicine Taxes, and US-India Tariff WarFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, during an exclusive interview with India Today TV, addressed public's queries from Lucknow on key economic issues, including GST slabs and international trade tariffs.

Nirmala Sitharaman answers questions on GST reforms from KolkataFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, during an exclusive interview with India Today TV, addressed questions of public from Kolkata regarding recent GST reforms.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as auto sector stocks offset losses by IT sharesThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by just 7.25 points to close at 80,710.76, while the NSE Nifty50 gained a paltry 6.70 points to end at 24,741.00.

Exclusive: Why GST started with 4 slabs? Nirmala Sitharaman explainsWhen GST was launched in 2017, it came with four slabs, 5%, 12%, 18% and 28%. With GST 2.0 now moving to a simpler two-slab system, Nirmala Sitharaman has explained why the original multi-slab structure was necessary.

Exclusive: Will common man get insurance rate cut benefits in GST 2.0? FM answersFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman made it clear that the tax relief was introduced for citizens and not for insurance companies.

Popcorn puzzle solved: Nirmala Sitharaman explains GST classificationIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman explained why salted and chocolate-coated variants had earlier attracted different GST rates.

Why petrol, diesel is still not part of GST? Nirmala Sitharaman answersThe new GST 2.0 promises a simpler, two-rate structure and relief for many sectors. But fuel, petrol and diesel, remains outside its ambit. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has explained the reason behind this decision.

What's next after GST 2.0? Nirmala Sitharaman on GST 3.0 plansFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has confirmed that GST 2.0, with its new two-slab framework, will begin on September 22. But the bigger question is, what lies ahead in GST 3.0?

Benz vs Hawai chappal: Nirmala Sitharaman on why India isn't ready for uniform GSTIn an exclusive conversation with India Today TV, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated that while "one nation, one tax" remains an aspirational idea, India's uneven levels of development make a uniform GST rate unfair.

Exclusive: How will government ensure GST cut benefits pass on to consumers? FM explainsFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman addressed concerns about rate-cut benefits being passed on to people, explaining how the government plans to track the benefits in an exclusive with India Today.

GST rate cuts must be passed on to public, that's the focus: Nirmala SitharamanIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said GST 2.0's success hinges on strict vigilance to ensure rate cuts are fully passed on to consumers.

GST rate cut, portfolio reset: Where should your money go now?The Goods and Services Tax (GST) is moving away from the four-slab system of 5%, 12%, 18% and 28% to a simpler structure of just two main rates, 5% and 18%.

Life and health insurance premiums exempt from GST: How much will you save?With full GST exemption, life and health insurance premiums could become lower, potentially saving policyholders several thousand rupees. The change is expected to cover all individual policies, including term plans, ULIPs, endowments, and senior citizen health plans.

Buying a home vs investing in stocks: Which builds more wealth, explains expertIndians often believe owning a house is the ultimate financial goal. But when it comes to wealth creation, stocks may have left property behind. An expert breaks down the real returns.

Explained: Why stock markets are down despite GST 2.0 reformsThe BSE Sensex slipped 254.91 points to 80,463.10, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 69.25 points to 24,665.05 at 12:08 pm. Both benchmarks had gained in early trade.

Government may announce schemes to help exporters hit by Trump tariffs: SourcesWith textiles, gems, and leather shipments now weighed down by a 50% duty, the government is drawing up a relief package aimed at keeping liquidity flowing and jobs intact.

ITR filing after September 15? Here's the penalty and conditions you must checkThe extended deadline to file income tax returns (ITR) for FY 2024–25 is September 15, 2025. Missing it means your return will be treated as belated, attracting penalties and interest. Here's what you need to know.

GST 2.0: Diwali gift for the middle class, but what about businesses?The GST rate cut boost to consumer sentiment is expected to drive demand, but industry experts say that the reforms also carry long-term benefits for businesses.
GST 2.0: Essentials cheaper, but these items will now cost moreWhile essentials will see meaningful relief, everyday indulgences and luxury items will carry heavier taxes.

GST cuts drive auto sector rally: Top stocks to keep on your radarWith the festive season approaching, experts believe that automobile companies will be among the biggest winners of the recent rate cuts in GST.

Sensex, Nifty extend gains as GST cut optimism fuels Dalal Street rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained nearly 300 points in early trade, while the Nifty50 climbed past 24,800, signalling the possibility of a fresh rally if a favourable outcome emerges on the US tariff front.

Oracle, Salesforce cut hundreds of jobs in US as tech layoffs drag on: ReportIn filings with state regulators, the two software giants disclosed plans to eliminate more than 500 jobs in the Bay Area and nearly 200 in the Seattle region. Salesforce is cutting 262 roles in San Francisco, while Oracle is eliminating 254 jobs spread across Redwood City, Pleasanton and Santa Clara.

How much will you invest in US? Trump presses tech titans at White House dinnerAt a White House dinner with top tech CEOs, Donald Trump pressed Apple, Google, Meta, and Microsoft on their US investments.

What after Armani: The way ahead for iconic Italian fashion empireGiorgio Armani, who died at 91 leaving no children, built one of the world's most iconic fashion brands and ensured its future independence through a foundation.

US scraps Biden-era plan mandating airlines to pay for flight disruptionsIn December, the US Department of Transportation under then-President Joe Biden sought public comment on the rulemaking process about whether airlines should be required to pay $200 to $300 for domestic delays of at least three hours and up to $775 for longer delays.

GST reforms: Will consumption and investment get a real boost? Experts debateA major overhaul of the Goods and Services Tax, termed GST 2.0, has been initiated, which the government is calling a significant 'Diwali bonus' for consumers and the economy.

GST 2.0 is game-changing and transformational reform: Piyush GoyalIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV's Managing Editor Marya Shakil, Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal called GST 2.0 the most game-changing and transformational reform the country has seen in several decades.

GST 2.0 a game-changing reform for citizens and businesses: Piyush GoyalUnion Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has described the new GST 2.0 reforms as a "game-changing" move that will simplify taxes, reduce prices on daily essentials, and give a major boost to India's economy.

Zara, Lacoste, and other global brands face higher GST: ReportInternational names such as Zara, H&M, Levi's, Lacoste, Nike and Uniqlo could be directly impacted. These brands rely heavily on India's growing middle-class youth, who see branded apparel as a lifestyle upgrade but remain highly price-sensitive.

GST reforms commendable, will have far-reaching benefits: Anand SharmaIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, former Commerce Minister Anand Sharma provides his assessment of the next-generation GST reforms.

Sensex, Nifty end higher: Is GST 2.0 next big trigger for the economy?Speaking on the possible impact on the market closing show on BT TV, Vinit Bolinjkar, Head of Research at Ventura Securities, said the domestic economy is set for a strong rebound.

What are 'sin' goods? All you need to know about special 40% GST slabFrom September 22, 2025, India will have a simpler GST system with just two main rates and a special 40% slab. This top rate applies only to a few products, popularly known as 'sin goods'. Let's break it down.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as profit booking caps GST 2.0 rallyAnalysts said the day began on a strong note, with sweeping GST rate cuts fuelling broad-based buying in auto, FMCG, and consumer durable stocks. However, sustained selling pressure in the second half of trade eroded much of the early momentum.

GST 2.0 guide: What gets cheaper, costlier, and everything in betweenJust as the festival season approaches, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has delivered a comprehensive GST overhaul that will put more money back into the pockets of Indians.

entertainment.headline: Rakesh Roshan turns 76: Ameesha, Simi Garewal extend wishes with throwback picsActor Ameesha Patel wished her mentor Rakesh Roshan on his 76th birthday. She called him a 'beacon of hope' by sharing a throwback photo. His actor-friend Simi Garewal also wrote a sweet birthday note for him.

Chandra gave me goosebumps: Samantha cheers for Kalyani Priyadarshan's Lokah'Lokah: Chapter 1', featuring Kalyani Priyadarshan as India's first female superhero, has garnered widespread acclaim for its captivating blend of mythology and fantasy. Recently, Samantha joined the list of celebs who hailed the movie.

Bigg Boss 19: Salman Khan scolds Amaal Malik, asks if he only came to sleepBigg Boss 19 host Salman Khan scolded singer Amaal Malik for not living up to the audience's expectations as a contestant on the reality show. Salman asked Amaal whether he wanted to make a difference or not.

Amol Parashar responds to relationship buzz with Konkona: People made it officialAmol Parashar addressed rumours about his relationship with Konkona Sensharma, clarifying their public appearance was just a casual event with friends and family.

SIIMA 2025 full winners list: Allu Arjun, Rashmika Mandanna win bigThe South Indian International Movie Awards 2025 celebrated outstanding achievements in South Indian cinema, with 'Kalki 2898 AD' winning Best Film and multiple honours for 'Pushpa 2: The Rule'.

Director Vikram Bhatt's mother dies at 85 after prolonged illness. ReportDirector-producer Vikram Bhatt's mother Varsha Bhatt died at 85 after a prolonged illness, according to reports. The family is yet to release an official statement.

Bigg Boss 19: Tanya Mittal's family reacts to criticism, requests people to be kind'Bigg Boss 19' contestant Tanya Mittal is currently at the centre of social media debates. Her parents have now appealed for fairness and asked viewers to reserve judgment until the show ends.

Die My Love trailer: Robert Pattinson, Jennifer Lawrence play a chaotic coupleLynne Ramsay has returned to direction with her new film 'Die My Love', featuring Jennifer Lawrence and Robert Pattinson. The movie shows a chaotic life of a couple living in rural Montana.

Mohanlal reacts to stepping down from Malayalam film body: It was time to move onMohanlal resigned as AMMA president following criticism over the handling of sexual abuse complaints, clarifying his decision was a timely conclusion rather than a response to public pressure.

A Very Jonas Christmas teaser: The Jonas Brothers' festive fun is here to sleighThe Jonas Brothers have delighted fans with a sneak peek of their festive film 'A Very Jonas Christmas Movie', premiering on Disney+ this November. Featuring comedy, music, and family moments, the movie promises a joyous holiday experience with a star-studded cast and original songs.

Can nostalgia save theatres? Bollywood-Hollywood bet on cinema icons and memoriesPop culture icons are the new flavour of the season in Indian cinema and Hollywood. Where is cinema headings with the announcement of Sourav Ganguly and Meena Kumari biopics, 'Rambo' origins story, 'I Play Rocky' and 'The Smashing Machine'? On Cinematic Saturday, we reflect on the future of storytelling as filmmakers recreate nostalgia to evoke audience emotions.

Dhamaal 4 shoot wraps up, set for Eid 2026 releaseActor Ajay Devgn has officially wrapped up 'Dhamaal 4' shoot in Mumbai after six months. The film promises a unique blend of comedy, drama and action for its Eid 2026 release.

Who is Ashish Warang? Remembering the Marathi actor who died at 55Ashish Warang, a versatile actor known for his impactful supporting roles across Bollywood, Marathi and South Indian cinema, has died at 55. His memorable performances in films like 'Drishyam' and 'Sooryavanshi' will continue to be cherished by audiences and peers alike.

Jonathan Bailey announces break from actingJonathan Bailey is taking a break from acting next year to focus on The Shameless Fund, an LGBTQ+ charity he founded. He was last seen in 'Jurassic World Rebirth'.

Madharaasi vs Ghaati box office Day 1: Sivakarthikeyan-Murugadoss film races aheadSivakarthikeyan's 'Madharaasi' has opened to a strong box office response, overshadowing Anushka Shetty's 'Ghaati' on its first day. Both films received mixed reviews.

Baaghi 4 vs Bengal Files box office Day 1: Tiger Shroff's actioner dominates'Baaghi 4' and 'The Bengal Files' clashed at the box office with contrasting opening performances. While Tiger Shroff's action-packed 'Baaghi 4' impressed with strong collections, Vivek Agnihotri's complex drama struggled to make an impact amid stiff competition.

Ahaan Panday-Aneet Padda celebrate Saiyaara's 50-day run with dreamy picturesMohit Suri's 'Saiyaara', starring debutants Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has completed 50 days in theatres, crossing Rs 500 crore worldwide to become Indian cinema's highest-grossing love story.

Kiku Sharda shuts down rumours of rift with Krushna Abhishek, says bond is unbreakableComedian Kiku Sharda has dismissed rumours of a fallout with co-star Krushna Abhishek, affirming his ongoing role in 'The Great Indian Kapil Show'. Fans can look forward to the remaining episodes on Netflix as the cast's strong camaraderie remains intact.

Bad Girl review: A coming-of-age masterpiece about breaking patriarchal chainsRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025Bad Girl movie review: Director Varsha Bharath's 'Bad Girl' is a fantastic coming-of-age film of a woman. This lovely gem of a film lays bare patriarchy and showcases how women are slowly breaking away from generational trauma.

general news.headline: India-US thaw incoming? Trump lowers offensive, PM 'deeply appreciates'Donald Trump appeared to break the ice amid the strain in India-US ties, harping on the strong personal bond between him and PM Modi. PM Modi was quick to respond. Is a thaw between India and the US incoming?

Sharjeel Imam goes to Supreme Court against bail denial in 2020 Delhi riots caseSharjeel Imam has moved the Supreme Court challenging the Delhi High Court's September 2 order denying him bail in the UAPA case linked to the alleged larger conspiracy behind the 2020 North-East Delhi riots.

After EU leaders, PM speaks to France's Macron; discusses early end to Ukraine warAmid US President Donald Trump's ongoing efforts to end the war between Russia and Ukraine, India has emerged as an alternative diplomatic channel for the West, especially after Putin himself acknowledged New Delhi's role in promoting peace during the recently-concluded SCO summit in China.

'Half-naked' man attacks women in Meerut's deserted areas, cops on alertVillagers claimed similar attacks had occurred twice earlier, with women and girls being targeted by a man appearing suddenly from sugarcane fields.

Ex-Astronomer HR Kristin Cabot files for divorce months after Coldplay kiss cam rowIn July, Kristin Cabot was caught in an intimate hug with her boss Andy Byron when they were seen on the big screen during a Coldplay concert.

Dust of Bihar politics too much? BJP ridicules Rahul Gandhi's Malaysia tripTime and again, the BJP has targeted Rahul Gandhi's foreign visits, especially during Parliament sessions or in the middle of election campaigns.

Fully reciprocate his sentiments: PM as Trump dials down with 'friends' remarkThe Prime Minister's remarks come after Trump said he would 'always be friends' with Modi, in an apparent climbdown, a day after he asserted that the US had 'lost India to China'.

Comeback kid Congress? Will Bihar walk Rahul Gandhi's Voter Adhikar talk?The Voter Adhikar Yatra, with Tejashwi Yadav and other INDIA leaders, may have just given the Congress what it lacked in the Bihar poll theatre: visibility and legitimacy

Lt Parul Dhadwal etches history, becomes 5th-gen officer from family to join ArmyLt Parul Dhadwal has become the first woman officer from a five-generation military family, commissioned into the Army Ordnance Corps and awarded the President's Gold Medal for topping her course at Officers Training Academy Chennai.

6 killed after wire of cargo ropeway snaps at Gujarat templeSix people, including workers and liftmen, died after a cargo ropeway crashed at Pavagadh's hill temple on Saturday. The accident occurred due to a rope break, and an investigation is underway.

Good ties matter: Akhilesh Yadav on Trump's friendship remark for PM ModiAkhilesh Yadav reacted to Trump's remarks on PM Modi, stating that friendship is different and strong, stable ties between India and the US should continue beyond political dynamics.

Ruthless India demolish China to storm into Asia Cup final against KoreaIndia produced their best performance in the Asia Cup 2025 as they demolished China 7-0 to make it to the final of the tournament in Rajgir. Abhishek hit a brace as Indian players were in free-scoring form on Saturday.

Ganesh Visarjan 2025: Devotees bid farewell to Bappa with grandeur across IndiaAs chants of Ganpati Bappa Morya echoed across the nation, devotees bid an emotional farewell to Lord Ganesha. The vibrant visarjan processions lit up streets with music, dance, and devotion.

When India imported insects to fight pestsWhat does a country do when pests end up flying across borders, stuck on ships or hidden in food consignments, threatening crops and native plants? Faced with such destruction, India has imported insects from the UK and Africa to fight the pest menace.

Maharashtra boy, 10, dies of heart attack after feeling uneasy while playingA 10-year-old Shravan Ajit Gavade from Kolhapur died of a sudden heart attack while playing at a Ganpati mandal, leaving his family devastated.

RSS flag with 'Op Sindoor' written on floral carpet at Kerala temple sparks rowCalling the case against RSS and BJP workers over a floral carpet displaying the RSS flag "shameful and seditious", Kerala BJP chief Rajeev Chandrasekhar demanded its immediate withdrawal, saying it insulted both the armed forces and the victims of terrorism.

Where is cinema headings with the announcement of Sourav Ganguly and Meena Kumari biopics, 'Rambo' origins story, 'I Play Rocky' and 'The Smashing Machine'? On Cinematic Saturday, we reflect on the future of storytelling as filmmakers recreate nostalgia to evoke audience emotions.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

1 killed, several injured in blast during cricket match at stadium in PakistanA video of the blast that has gone viral shows people running as thick plumes of smoke billow in the background. The blast was reported at the Kausar Cricket Ground in Khar tehsil.

When Bengal assembly turned Ground Zero of Mamata-BJP warThe Trinamool-BJP battle in the run-up to the Bengal assembly polls is taking the shape of a bitter face-off over Bangla identity, history and the very right to speak the language

Why you shouldn't miss the Moon turning blood-red on SundayFor 82 minutes, the Moon will appear dramatically red to observers across the globe. During this time, the contrast between the dim, copper-hued Moon and the surrounding stars will be breathtaking.

'Move hand from your face': Amity student slapped 26 times in viral videoThe video shows two people, including a woman, repeatedly raining blows on the law student of Lucknow's Amity University. The student was slapped as many as '25-30' times over 90 seconds.

Khalistani terror groups operate, raise funds, Canada admits in new risk reportCanada has long ignored India's repeated concerns about Khalistani elements' anti-India activities on Canadian soil, an issue that has soured relations between the two countries.

26 detained after National Emblem on plaque vandalised at J&K's Hazratbal shrineThe detentions were made after police reviewed CCTV footage from the scene, which clearly captured the individuals involved in the defacement of the emblem.

sports.headline: Anwar Ali: India must step up after Sandesh Jhingan's injury at CAFA Nations CupIndia's defender Anwar Ali urges teammates to fill the void left by injured Sandesh Jhingan ahead of the Oman match. The Blue Tigers aim to secure third place in their maiden CAFA Nations Cup campaign despite defensive challenges.

Italian GP: Max Verstappen breaks Monza lap record to take pole ahead of Lando NorrisMax Verstappen set a new Monza track record to claim pole position at the Italian Grand Prix. Lando Norris looked set to take the top spot but the Dutchman managed to do the unthinkable to take the first spot on the grid.

Ruthless India demolish China to storm into Asia Cup final against KoreaIndia produced their best performance in the Asia Cup 2025 as they demolished China 7-0 to make it to the final of the tournament in Rajgir. Abhishek hit a brace as Indian players were in free-scoring form on Saturday.

ZIM vs SL: Raza, Evans help Zimbabwe level series with historic 5-wicket winZimbabwe made a sensational comeback to win the second T20I against Sri Lanka by five wickets at Harare. Sikandar Raza and Brad Evans skittled Sri Lanka for 80 in the first innings.

Shubham's 96 helps Central Zone take lead, Khajuria's ton rescues North ZoneRajat Patidar and Shubham Sharma's brilliant knocks put Central Zone in commanding position in the Duleep Trophy semi final. Their key partnerships have brought the team close to a final berth, while North Zone faces a tough challenge to recover.

IND vs CHN, Highlights India take hammering 7-0 win, storms into the finalIndia vs China, Hockey Asia Cup 2025 Highlights: India went on to secure a 7-0 win by hammering China in their final Super 4 clash to book their spot in the finals.

Shivam Dube reveals Gautam Gambhir's inspirational message before Asia Cup 2025India commenced their Asia Cup 2025 preparations with an inspiring session led by coach Gautam Gambhir. The team aims to build on recent successes as they face tough group stage opponents in the UAE.

No government restrictions, India will play vs every team in Asia Cup: BCCIThe BCCI (Board of Control for Cricket in India) secretary Devajit Saika has said that the board is following the government's stance ahead of playing against Pakistan in the upcoming Asia Cup 2025.

Shreyas Iyer appeals for donations to support flood-hit PunjabPunjab Kings (PBKS) captain and India batter Shreyas Iyer has appealed to the fans, asking for donations to provide relief to the victims of the flood-hit Punjab.

Daniel Ricciardo confirms racing retirement, joins Ford as racing ambassadorDaniel Ricciardo has confirmed that his racing days are behind him. He however, has now taken a new ambassadorial role with Ford.

Daniel Ricciardo confirms racing retirement, joins Ford as racing ambassadorDaniel Ricciardo has confirmed that his racing days are behind him. He however, has now taken a new ambassadorial role with Ford.

BCCI to get new president on September 28 as elections in AGM in MumbaiThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) will elect a new president at its 94th Annual General Meeting (AGM), scheduled for 11:30 am on 28 September 2025 at the board's headquarters in Mumbai.

After Asia Cup snub, Shreyas Iyer named India A captain for Australia A tourShreyas Iyer has been named the India A captain for the upcoming two multi-day matches against Australia A, beginning on September 16.

Looks much better: Fans give thumbs to India training kit minus Dream11 logoThe Indian Cricket Board is without a lead jersey sponsor in the Asia Cup. As the photos of new 'sponsorless' jersey emerged, the fans gave it a thumbs up for aesthetics.

Watch: Rohit Sharma urges fans to stop 'Mumbai cha Raja' chants at Ganesh templeIndia ODI captain Rohit Sharma sought blessings at Lord Ganesh temple before his international return. He urged his fans to stop chanting his name out of reverence for the almighty.

Australia ready for challenging Indian conditions in Women's World Cup: HealyAustralia women's cricket team captain Alyssa Healy expresses confidence ahead of the 2025 Women's World Cup in India. The defending champions are focused on overcoming local challenges and achieving back-to-back titles.

Test cricket will always remain my priority: Starc after T20I retirementAustralia pacer Mitchell Starc has stated that he is willing to push his body to its limits to continue playing Test cricket. Starc recently retired from T20Is to concentrate on the ODI World Cup and his Test career.

Asia Cup: India look to continue fearless mode as road to T20 World Cup beginsIndia enter the Asia Cup 2025 as defending champions, combining youth and experience. With Shubman Gill back in the squad, Jasprit Bumrah's expertise, and Arshdeep Singh's rise, the Men in Blue aim to fine-tune a team for the next era of T20 cricket.

Sinner, Alcaraz reach US Open final, end Big Three's 23-year-old Slam streakThe Jannik Sinner-Carlos Alcaraz era in men's tennis has taken full flight after a sensational Grand Slam season in 2025. For the first time since 2003, a season has passed without Novak Djokovic, Roger Federer or Rafael Nadal featuring in a Grand Slam final.

Australia ready for challenging Indian conditions in Women's World Cup: HealyAustralia women's cricket team captain Alyssa Healy expresses confidence ahead of the 2025 Women's World Cup in India. The defending champions are focused on overcoming local challenges and achieving back-to-back titles.

Test cricket will always remain my priority: Starc after T20I retirementAustralia pacer Mitchell Starc has stated that he is willing to push his body to its limits to continue playing Test cricket. Starc recently retired from T20Is to concentrate on the ODI World Cup and his Test career.

With Shubman Gill back in the squad, Jasprit Bumrah's expertise, and Arshdeep Singh's rise, the Men in Blue aim to fine-tune a team for the next era of T20 cricket.

Sinner, Alcaraz reach US Open final, end Big Three's 23-year-old Slam streakThe Jannik Sinner-Carlos Alcaraz era in men's tennis has taken full flight after a sensational Grand Slam season in 2025. For the first time since 2003, a season has passed without Novak Djokovic, Roger Federer or Rafael Nadal featuring in a Grand Slam final.

Carlos Alcaraz shares Roger Federer's advice ahead of US Open finalCarlos Alcaraz stormed into the final of the US Open after beating Novak Djokovic. After setting up the final against Jannik Sinner, Alcaraz recounted Roger Federer's advice.

IOC creates panel to review female issues in Olympic sportsThe IOC has formed a confidential female protection panel ahead of the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics. This move aims to address gender issues while maintaining the integrity of the group's work amid ongoing sports controversies.

Sinner vs Alcaraz: How US Open 2025 final will settle race for World No. 1The US Open final between Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz will decide not only the season's last Grand Slam title but also the battle for World No. 1 in the PIF ATP Rankings.

Jannik Sinner sets up grand Sincaraz final after 4-set battle vs Auger AliassimeWorld No.1 Jannik Sinner set up a grand US Open final against Carlos Alcaraz. On Saturday, Sinner beat Canada's Felix Auger Aliassime with mechanical precision in a 4-set battle.

FIDE Grand Swiss: Gukesh held by 14-year-old Erdogmus; Vaishali in joint leadWorld Champion D. Gukesh was held to a draw by the 14-year-old Turkish prodigy Yagiz Khan Erdogmus while Vaishali impressed with consecutive wins, strengthening her lead in the women's section.

Luis Suarez banned for 6 games after spitting saga in Leagues Cup finalInter Miami's Luis Suarez has been handed a 6-game ban for his antics in the Leagues Cup final against Seattle Sounders. Suarez had spit on the face of one of the opposition staff.

Inside Rajgir sports complex: Cradle of Bihar's sporting culture revival, dreamsWith world-class facilities and an international cricket stadium on the way, the Rajgir Sports Complex is leading a revolution in Bihar by reviving the state's sporting culture and laying out new dreams.

Tim Henman makes Novak Djokovic retirement prediction after US Open lossFormer British No.1 Tim Henman has tipped Novak Djokovic to make one final push at the Australian Open before considering retirement, after the Serbian great's US Open exit at the hands of Carlos Alcaraz.

Sabalenka vs Anisimova Live Streaming: All you need to know about finalUS Open 2025: World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka and Amanda Anisimova of the United States will be up against each other in the women's singles final at Flushing Meadows on Saturday, September 6.

Once ageless, now 38, Djokovic just can't stop the Sincaraz partyAt 38, Novak Djokovic still chases a record-breaking 25th Grand Slam, but the Sincaraz party shows no mercy. Even the GOAT may need something extraordinary to crash it. And whether he can is anyone's guess as the young guns keep raising the bar.

Djokovic quashes retirement buzz after US Open exit: Want to play majors in 2026Novak Djokovic confirmed he is not retiring after his US Open 2025 loss to Carlos Alcaraz. He plans to compete in the 2026 Grand Slam season despite physical challenges in longer matches.

Novak Djokovic no match for ruthless Carlos Alcaraz in one-sided semisCarlos Alcaraz defeated Novak Djokovic to reach the US Open 2025 men's singles final. Alcaraz took two hours and 23 minutes to register a 6-4, 7-6 (4), 6-2 victory at Arthur Ashe Stadium.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
